title: Ancient Kangaroos Were Heavier Than Grizzly Bears But Could Still Hop - explorersweb.com
description: Ancient Kangaroos Were Heavier Than Grizzly Bears But Could Still Hop explorersweb.comKangaroos’ giant ancestor probably able to hop despite 250kg weight, scientists say The GuardianBiomechanical limits of hopping in the hindlimbs of giant extinct kangaroos | Scientific Reports NatureAncient giant kangaroos could have hopped despite their huge size New Scientist

title: eDNA research unlocks ancient secrets of Angkor Region
description: The APSARA National Authority (ANA), in collaboration with international experts, organised a seminar on Environmental DNA (eDNA) research to promote new collaborative projects and present preliminary findings in the Angkor region. The seminar was held yesterday at the APSARA National Authority Centre.The post eDNA research unlocks ancient secrets of Angkor Region appeared first on Khmer Times.

title: AD: ANCIENT ALIENS! LIVING DINOSAURS! PHANTOM CLOWNS!
description: After Dark Radio with Bryan Alvarez is back with TONS to talk about on a fun solo show, including Squatchfest this weekend, thoughts on the Ancient Aliens TV show after some binge-watching, living dinosaurs including one Bryan has never heard of, phantom clowns, and tons more! A fun show as always so check it out~! [...]

title: Animal Offerings and Painted Walls Reveal Secrets of the Ancient Roman Cult Site Nida
description: Discover Magazine’s award-winning journalism inspires and informs, delivering thought-provoking content that sparks meaningful conversations. title: SW China’s ancient Tea Horse Road finds new life in modern ‘slow travel’
description: KUNMING (Jan 29): After years of living in China, Antonio from Spain discovered a new passion in the intricate world of tea, noting that his trip through Yunnan in southwest China sparked this love. On his days off, he often takes European tourists along the ancient Tea Horse Road to explore the crossroads of tea [...]The post SW China’s ancient Tea Horse Road finds new life in modern ‘slow travel’ appeared first on Borneo Post Online.
